plants.name: Lilium superbum
plants.description: A striking perennial lily native to eastern North America, known for its orange, recurved petals with prominent dark spots. It grows in moist woodlands and meadows.
plants.funFact: Turk's Cap Lily flowers are highly attractive to butterflies and hummingbirds, which act as its primary pollinators.

plants.name: Lavandula angustifolia
plants.description: A fragrant evergreen shrub widely cultivated for its aromatic purple flower spikes and essential oils. It thrives in Mediterranean climates and is common in gardens worldwide.
plants.funFact: Lavender's essential oils are known for their calming properties and are often used in aromatherapy.

plants.name: Rhododendron arboreum
plants.description: A large evergreen shrub or small tree featuring clusters of bright red or crimson flowers. It grows in mountainous regions of the Himalayas, blooming mid-summer.
plants.funFact: Rhododendron arboreum is Nepal's national flower and can survive at high altitudes up to 3,500 meters.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree or shrub that produces cylindrical flower spikes with brush-like yellow blooms. It is common along eastern coastal areas.
plants.funFact: Banksias provide an important nectar source for birds and mammals during the Australian winter months.
